basics.name: Luis Alberto Rodríguez Meneses
basics.label: Innovative scientist and IoT developer focused on the research and implementation of intelligent systems
basics.summary: As an Electronics Ph.D., I specialize in integrating Internet of Things (IoT) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies. My expertise lies in creating robust IoT ecosystems that bridge digital and physical realms, enhanced by AI capabilities. I develop innovative solutions that improve user experiences and operational efficiency across various sectors. By combining IoT sensor networks with AI-powered analytics, I build systems for real-time monitoring, predictive maintenance, and autonomous decision-making. This approach transforms raw data into actionable insights, addressing complex challenges in our increasingly connected and data-driven world.

work.name: Trafficlight de México
work.position: Technical Leader of Research and Technological Development
work.summary: Spearheaded comprehensive project management and technological innovation initiatives in the smart city domain. Led multifaceted teams in the conceptualization, development, and deployment of advanced urban systems. These projects encompassed intelligent Traffic Light Control networks, environmental monitoring sensor arrays, interactive controllers for large-scale video mapping installations, and AI-powered vehicle detection and counting systems. This strategic leadership role encompassed the entire project lifecycle, from initial design through to final implementation, integrating cutting-edge technologies to enhance urban infrastructure and improve city operations. By overseeing these diverse and complex projects, the role contributed significantly to the advancement of smart city technologies, driving efficiency and sustainability in urban environments.

work.name: Trafficlight de México
work.summary: Orchestrated the end-to-end development of cutting-edge environmental sensor networks, seamlessly integrating them as IoT devices within smart city infrastructures. Pioneered the architecture, development, and deployment of comprehensive IoT ecosystems, encompassing both local and cloud-based solutions. This work bridged the gap between environmental monitoring and urban intelligence, leveraging IoT technology to enhance city operations and sustainability initiatives.

work.name: Instituto Tecnológico Superior de San Andrés Tuxtla
work.position: Coordinator of Master's Degree in Engineering
work.summary: Spearheaded the Technology Transfer Office (TTO), a strategic unit focused on identifying commercially viable technological innovations and intellectual property. Key responsibilities included overseeing IP management, streamlining patent application processes, facilitating the commercialization of university research through licensing agreements, and providing expert counsel on research contract terms. Served as a Research Project Evaluator and member of the Institutional Internal Committee for Research Projects, playing a crucial role in assessing and guiding research initiatives. Actively promoted and fostered high-impact technological research projects aimed at driving economic and technological development in the Los Tuxtlas region of Veracruz.

work.name: National Institute of Astrophysics, Optics and Electronics (INAOE)
work.summary: Engineered and implemented a comprehensive UHF radio frequency link for the pioneering Mexican nanosatellite project, 'Ulises I'. This work encompassed the entire development cycle, including design, fabrication, validation, and performance testing. The system was specifically tailored for telemetry data monitoring and remote nanosatellite control. Additionally, the project involved the design and performance analysis of fundamental dipole antenna systems, optimized for nanosatellite communications within the UHF spectrum.
